intro: Erigeron looseri, commonly known as the Looser's blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It features slender stems with grayish-green leaves and produces small, blue to purple flowers in the summer. Erigeron looseri is often found in areas with well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid climates.
